org.apparatus_templi

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ControllerModule, SensorModule

    public abstract class Driver
extends Object
implements Runnable
    An abstract class for a basic driver. This driver should not be sub-classed directly. Each driver should subclass either SensorModule or ControllerModule. Drivers directly sub-classing Driver might not be loaded. for execution.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE

        static final String TYPE
        Used to determine which type of Driver each driver should be cast to.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • name

        protected String name
        The unique name of this driver. This name should match the name of the remote module it corresponds with, and must be 10 characters or less.

      • isRunning

        protected volatile boolean isRunning
        Indicates whether or not this driver should continue running, or begin its termination process. If the driver executes in a continuous loop after loading, then it should check the status of this flag after every loop.

      • queuedCommands

        protected volatile Deque<String> queuedCommands
        A queue of commands that were sent to this driver while it was inactive. The status of each driver is determined by its Thread.State. If a driver is terminated then any incoming messages will be placed in this queue before the driver is restarted. Each driver should check (or clear) this queue within its run() method. If the driver runs continuously then this queue should be checked during each loop.

      • queuedBinary

        protected volatile Deque<byte[]> queuedBinary
        A queue of data that was sent to this driver while it was inactive. The status of each driver is determined by its Thread.State. If a driver is terminated then any incoming messages will be placed in this queue before the driver is restarted. Each driver should check (or clear) this queue within its run() method. If the driver runs continuously then this queue should be checked during each loop.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        public Driver()

    • Method Detail

      • receiveCommand

        abstract void receiveCommand(String command)
        Sends a command to this drivers remote module. This is the interface that the front-ends use to control each remote module. It is up to each driver to check the incoming command for validity before calling Coordinator.sendCommand(Driver, String)
        Parameters:
        command - the command to send to the remote module.

      • receiveBinary

        abstract void receiveBinary(byte[] data)
        Sends binary data to this drivers remote module. This is the interface that the front-ends use to control each remote module. It is up to each driver to check the incoming data for validity before calling Coordinator.sendBinary(Driver, byte[])
        Parameters:
        data - the command to send to the remote module.

      • getWidgetXML

        abstract String getWidgetXML()
        Returns a String of XML data representing a widget view of this driver. The widget data should be a compact view of all sensor data or controller commands available, or full data from a limited set of sensors or controllers.
        Returns:
        a String of XML widget data.

      • getFullPageXML

        abstract String getFullPageXML()
        Returns a String of XML data representing a full view of this drivers data and capabilities. This XML data should be a detailed view of all the sensors data or controller commands available.
        Returns:
        a String of XML data.

      • terminate

        final void terminate()
        Notify the driver that it should begin terminating. More specifically sets the boolean flag isRunning to false. Drivers should query this flag periodically to know when to begin their termination procedure (if any).

      • getModuleName

        final String getModuleName()
        Returns the unique String name of this driver.
        Returns:
        the name of this driver.

      • queueCommand

        final void queueCommand(String command)

      • queueBinary

        final void queueBinary(byte[] data)
